function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Potential misinterpretation of wastewater data leading to premature public health actions","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possibility of estimating disease prevalence based on wastewater testing","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on wastewater testing to detect population-level prevalence of SARS-CoV-2","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in viral titer estimates from wastewater could lead to inaccurate calculations of disease prevalence","category":"Vision&Priorities","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limitations in testing capacity and criteria for testing could lead to an underestimate of clinically confirmed cases","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"A significant fraction of cases may go undetected with current testing algorithms, especially asymptomatic individuals","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete quantification of viral titers due to lack of investigation on recovery rates for each step in the process","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variations in PMMoV concentrations across samples without understanding the stability over time for the catchment population","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"High prevalence of SARS-CoV-2 in wastewater samples indicating potential community spread","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of data on viral shedding in stool over the clinical course of the disease","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on protocol without validation using expensive commercial kits","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential presence of viral genomes in sewage","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in viral load estimates in sewage and stool","category":"Vision&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large variation in viral load in stool samples","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variation in viral signal degradation during storage at 4°C","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Unstable sewage flow rate impacted by factors including rainstorms","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variation in PMMoV levels across samples with a standard deviation of 1.34 CT units","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limited access to testing for sars-cov-2 in the united states","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate surveillance of disease outbreaks in residential communities","category":"Participation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emergence of new variants of sars-cov-2","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mixing measles, mumps, and rubella mmr vaccine to test for broad-spectrum viral immunity","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of drugs with potential side effects for covid-19 treatment","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Knowledge gaps in understanding covid-19 and its differences from other viruses","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misunderstanding of environmental stability","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Children at risk of severe symptoms due to kawasaki syndrome and artery diseases.","category":"Family","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Higher infection rate in younger population due to insufficient social distancing and mask protection.","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Creation of pathogenic strains through synthetic biology","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Identification of patient zero","category":"Accountability","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Mutations leading to increased infectivity and immune evasion","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear research on virus origin","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential intermediate hosts in animal species","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of cross-border collaboration leading to uncoordinated efforts in disease control.","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of funding and weak programmatic capacity","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Call for strengthening vector control following the zika epidemic","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in the number of entomologists working at who’s headquarters in geneva","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complacency and lack of investment in vector control","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of political will and central coordination","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Geographic expansion of vectors and viruses through globalization and urbanization","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of investment in aedes vector control leading to ineffective prevention of aedes-borne epidemics","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relaxation of disease control programs in non-endemic regions","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglect of surveillance activities leading to increase in hat cases","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Scaling down of tsetse control campaigns leading to increase in hat cases","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Delay in eliminating transmission of hat by 2030","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Chagas disease and leishmaniasis transmission","category":"Organization","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reduction in prevalence of human microfilariae infections from 70% to negligible levels is reported.","category":"Vision&Priorities","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Onchocerciasis elimination program of the americas oepa launched in 1991, and the african programme for onchocerciasis control apoc established in 19 african countries.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Success of vector control against chagas disease in the southern cone initiative sci and similar initiatives in central america and andean pact countries.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Success of vector control in onchocerciasis control programme ocp in africa.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sociopolitical instability and limited socioeconomic development in malaria-endemic areas","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rebound of malaria transmission after intervention cessation","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"}]}
